word_mean: 残粒血液中的乳糜微粒经心肌、脂肪组织后水解和被摄取利用后粒径变小，在进入肝细胞最后摄取代谢之前的乳糜微粒称残粒。

sentence.Network_en: Obedience by women towards men is a remnant of religious teaching.
sentence.Network_cn: 女人对男人的顺从是宗教教义的残迹。

sentence.Network_en: The Ainu settlers in Hokkaido are the last remnant of a prehistoric race.
sentence.Network_cn: 北海道的阿伊努人是史前某个种族的最后残存者.

sentence.Network_en: It matters little where we pass the remnant of our days.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在什么地方度过我们的余年已经无关紧要.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...活跃于此世界中，同时并有由远古所流传下来、被称为“遗迹（Remnant）”的物体遍布在世界各地，人类的城镇基本上是围绕著遗迹 …

list.abs: 超新星遗迹(Supernova Remnant) 超新星遗迹其实可以算作行星状星云的一种,但在物理特性上与普通的行星状星云有所不同。著名的蟹状星云就是超新星的遗迹。.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: contraction of obsolete remenant from Old French remenant, from remenoir, remanoir 'remain'

encyclopedia.content: 名词n. [C] 1.残余，剩余；遗迹，遗风 Even today remnantsof this practice remain. 直至今日这一习俗仍然残存着。 2.零料，边角剩料；零头布 She bought a remnantof silk at a bargain. 她廉价购得一块零头丝布。 3.残存者[P]

entry.tran: 剩余部分;残余部分;残迹;残存物
entry.def: The remnants of something are small parts of it that are left over when the main part has disappeared or been destroyed.

example.ex: After twenty-four hours of fighting, the remnants of the force were fleeing...
example.tran: 战斗持续了24个小时后，该部队残部打算溜掉。

example.ex: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring...
example.tran: 在现在的教堂下面是古罗马时期地面的遗存。

entry.def: A remnant is a small piece of cloth that is left over when most of the cloth has been sold. Shops usually sell remnants cheaply.

means.word_mean: 1. a small part or portion that remains after the main part no longer exists
2. a piece of cloth that is left over after the rest has been used or sold

sentences.en: Even today remnants of this practice remain.
sentences.cn: 甚至在今天这种做法还未绝迹。
